references.paper_title: Training verifiers to solve math word problems
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the LLM evaluation methodology used in the current work, demonstrating the capabilities of LLMs in solving mathematical problems and providing insights into their evaluation.
This paper introduces a step-by-step verification method for LLMs, which directly influenced the design of the PSAS framework for step-level evaluation of physics reasoning.

references.paper_title: GPQA: A graduate-level google-proof q&a benchmark
references.reason: This paper introduced a high-level physics benchmark (GPQA) that inspired the development of PhysReason by highlighting the need for comprehensive and complex physics benchmarks.

references.paper_title: Mineru: An open-source solution for precise document content extraction
references.reason: This paper provides the open-source tool MinerU used for data processing and standardization in PhysReason, ensuring data quality and consistency.

references.paper_title: Symbol-LLM: Towards foundational symbol-centric interface for large language models
references.reason: This paper explores the use of symbolic reasoning in LLMs, providing a related theoretical background for physics-based reasoning and informing the design considerations of PhysReason.
